episode_title: 311 - The One Where Chandler Can’t Remember Which Sister

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica, Phoebe, Ross, Joey, and Rachel are there, Joey is demonstrating a card trick.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, pick a card, any card. (Monica picks one) All right, now memorize it. Show to everybody. Got it?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Um-mm.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, give it back to me. (takes the card back, but he looks at the card before he puts it back in the deck, he holds the deck to his forehead, and thinks a little while) 5 of hearts.
(Monica is sarcastically amazed.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Real magic does exist.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow. Joey, (sarcastically) how do you do it?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I can’t tell you that, no.
(We hear some knocking coming from the ceiling.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ah, somebody’s at the door on the ceiling.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Noo, that’s our unbelievably loud upstairs neighbor.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He took up the carpet, and now you can hear everything.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why don’t you go up there and ask him to ‘step lightly, please?’

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I have like five times, but the guy is so charming, that I go up there to yell and then I end up apologizing to him.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, that is silly. (gets up) I’ll go up there, I’ll tell him to keep it down.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, be my guest.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Good luck.
(Phoebe exits)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, all right, all right, all right, all right, you really wanna know how I did it, I’ll show ya. When you handed me back the card, what you didn’t see was, I looked at it so fast that it was invisible to the naked eye. (picks up a card and quickly looks at it) I just did it. (does it again) I just did it, again. Here, I’ll slow it down so that you guys can see it. (looks and the card in slow motion)

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh, I got it.
(We hear Phoebe knock at the door upstairs, and the guy answer it.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, look I was with my friend downstairs and we hear everything up here that you do, and I am sick and tired… (I tired but the rest is unintelligible).

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: Whoa, you are very beautiful.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, thank you.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, continued from earlier.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, anybody got a length of rope about six feet long with a little nouse at the end?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Honey, what’s the matter?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I just saw Janice.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, she was at Rockefeller Center skating with her husband, she looked so happy. I almost feel bad for whipping that kid’s pretzel at them.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Man, I remember the first time I saw that girl Katherine, after we broke up. She was just walking with her friend Donna, just laughing and talking. God, it killed me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, but you ended up having sex with both of them that afternoon.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sorry, I just, any excuse to tell that story y’know…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey Chandler, there’s a party tomorrow, you’ll feel better then.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, y’know what, I’m gonna be okay, you don’t have to throw a party for me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s Joey’s birthday.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, well then, if anybody should have a party it should be him.
(We hear Phoebe’s muffled voice through the ceiling.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sush!! I cannot believe she is still up there.
(We hear the guy telling a joke, and Phoebe laughing.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, well he totally screwed up the punch line. Y’know, it’s supposed to be arrghh-eh og-errigh.

content.speaker: Mr. Kaplan
content.text: How’s that coffee comin,’ dear?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, right away Mr. Kaplan.
content.parenthetical: jumping up from reading her magazine

content.speaker: Mr. Kaplan
content.text: I’m not supposed to drink coffee, it makes me gassy.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know!

content.speaker: Mr. Kaplan
content.text: I’ll bet your thinking, ‘What’s an intelligent girl who wants to be in fashion, doing making coffee?’ Eh?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Op.

content.speaker: Mr. Kaplan
content.text: Eh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, you got me.

content.speaker: Mr. Kaplan
content.text: Well, don’t think I haven’t noticed your potential. Well, I’ve got a project for you that’s a lot more related to fashion. How does that sound?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, that sounds great.

content.speaker: Mr. Kaplan
content.text: Come on over here, sweetheart. (they walk over to a storage closet)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh thank you so much Mr. Kaplan, thank you so much.

content.speaker: Mr. Kaplan
content.text: I need these hangers separated ASAP. (she is stunned) You’re welcome.
content.parenthetical: opening the closet door revealing that it’s full of tangled up hangers.

content.description: The Moondance Diner, Rachel is talking to Monica about her job.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh God, I hate my job, I hate it, I hate my job, I hate it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know honey, I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I wanna quit, but then I think I should stick it out, then I think why would such a person stay in such a demeaning job, just because it’s remotely related to the field they’re interested in.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Gee, I don’t know Rach. Order up!! I got a Yentel soup, a James Beans, and a Howdy hold the Dowdy!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh honey, come on, I’m sorry, I didn’t… I don’t mind paying my dues, y’know, its just how much am I gonna learn about fashion by walking Mira, the arthritic seamstress, to the bathroom.
(A guy at the end of the table starts laughing.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi! Is my misery amusing to you?

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: I’m sorry, I wa, I wa, I was just ah… (starts to laugh again)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s not funny, this is actually my job.

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: Oh believe me, I-I-I’ve been there. I had to sort mannequin heads at that Mannequins Plus.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh well then, so I’m just going to go back to talking to my friend here. And you can go back to enjoying your little hamburger.

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: Ah, just one other thing.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes?!

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: I ah, I work at Bloomingdale’s and I might know of a job possibility if your, if your interested?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: (to him) Do you want my pickle?

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, it’s Joey’s party.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Hey guys.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey Gunther. Hi. (to Phoebe) I mean you’re going out on a date with the noisy guy upstairs?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, he’s very charming.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know, he’s too charming, but if you two start going out, then it’s just gonna make it so much harder for me to hate him.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, you’re just gonna have to try.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey, where are the Jello shots?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know, Chandler is supposed to be passin’ ‘em around…
(Camera cuts to show Chandler giving a Jello shot to the ceramic dog and holding an empty tray of Jello shots.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Chandler!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hello-dillillio!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, somebody’s feeling better.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Stick out your tongue.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Take off your shirt!
(Chandler sticks out is tongue and it’s a horrible shade of green.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my God! How many of these things did you have? These are pure vodka.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, Jello just like Mom used to make.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: The most unbelievable thing happened to me today.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi! So I’m out having lunch at Monica’s and this guy starts talking to me, and it turns out he works for a buyer at Bloomingdale’s and there happens to be an opening in his department. So I gave him my phone number and he’s gonna call me this weekend to see if he can get me an interview!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What, so this guy is helping you for no apparent reason?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh-huh!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And he’s, he’s a total stranger?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah! His name is um, Mark something.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Huh. Sounds like Mark Something wants to have some sex.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What!?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I’m just saying, I mean why else would he just, y’know, swoop in out of nowhere for no reason.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: To be nice.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, Joey. Are men ever nice to strange women for no reason?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, only for sex.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thank you. (to Rachel) So did you ah, did you tell Mark Something about me?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I didn’t have to, because I was wearing my ‘I heart Ross’ sandwich board and ringing my bell.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Joey’s Sisters
content.text: Joey!!! Happy Birthday!! (all 7 of them look almost identical)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!! Hey-hey-hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, how many of that girl are you seeing?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How hammered are you? Huh? These, these are Joey’s sisters.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi Joey’s sisters!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!
content.parenthetical: to one of his sisters, Cookie

content.speaker: Cookie
content.text: Hey. What are we drinkin’ over here.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I have ah, vodka and cranberry juice.

content.speaker: Cookie
content.text: No kiddin,’ that’s the exact same drink I made myself right after I shot my husband.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow. Okay, I don’t know how to talk to you.
(cut to Chandler)

content.speaker: Sister 1
content.text: What ‘cha doing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, I’m taking my ex-girlfriend of my speed dialer.

content.speaker: Joey’s Sisters
content.text: Oh!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No-no-no-no, no, it’s a good thing. Why must we dial so speedily anyway? Why must we rush through life? Why can’t we savor the precious moments? (to one of Joey’s sisters) Those are some huge breasts you have.
(Cut to Ross and Monica)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. So um, I-I heard about this ah, Mark guy that ah, Rachel met today.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Isn’t that great?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh yeah! So ah, kinda pretty, pretty good. He sounds like a nice, good guy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, he is. And he is so dreamy. I mean, y’know what, when he left I actually used the phrase, ‘Hummina-hummina-hummina.’ (walks away)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s excellent.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica, Phoebe, Ross, and Rachel are eating breakfast.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, he’s just a nice guy. You really think this Mark doesn’t want anything in exchange for helping him?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I assume I’ll have to take showers with him, but y’know, that’s true of any job.
(Chandler enters hungover and groaning)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How ya feelin’?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, my apartment isn’t there anymore, because I drank it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Where’d you get too? We lost you after you opened up all the presents.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I ended up in the storage room, and not alone.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Woooo hoooo!!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ow, no ‘woo-hooing,’ no ‘woo-hooing.’

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why, what happened?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ah, I fooled around with Joey’s sister. (Phoebe gasps) Well, that’s not the worst part.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What is the worse part?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can’t remember which sister.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You see what men do! Don’t tell me men are not nice! (points to Chandler) This is men!!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, continued from earlier.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you insane? I mean Joey, is going to kill you, he’s actually going to kill you dead.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay! You don’t think I thought of that?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: How can you not know which one?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I mean that’s unbelievable.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I mean, was it Gina?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Which one is Gina?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Dark, big hair, with the airplane earrings.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, no, no, that’s Dina.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You see you can’t tell which one is which either, dwha!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: We didn’t fool around with any of them. Dwha! Dwha!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Veronica. Look, it’s got to be Veronica, the girl in the red skirt. I definitely stuck my tongue down her throat.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That was me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, when I’ve been drinking, sometimes I tend to get overly friendly, and I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s all right.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s okay.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Can I talk to you for a second?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, Joey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey. (they all walk away from Chandler)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on!! (motions for Chandler to come with him)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why can’t we talk in here? With, with, witnesses.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I just got off the phone with my sister.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ah, which, which one?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Mary-Angela.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Mary-Angela.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know which one was she again?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why don’t you ask Chandler, ‘cause he’s the one that fooled around with her. She told me you said you could really fall for her. Now is that true? Or are you just gettin’ over Janice by groping my sister.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s gotta be the first one.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Really? That’s great! You and my sister, sittin’ in a tree.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yep, I’m in a tree.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica is writing letters as Rachel enters.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Did he call? Did Mark call?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No honey, I’m sorry, but the weekend’s not over yet.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh. (we hear laughing from the upstairs apartment) Oh my God, is that Phoebe?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I guess they’re back from their date.
(He starts to play music.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Music. Very nice.
(We hear them start making out upstairs.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So, how are you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I am good. I finished my book.
(Things start to get really hot upstairs.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah, what’s it about?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t remember. Do you wanna take a walk?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I do. (they both run out)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Ross is reading a letter that Chandler wrote.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Dear Mary-Angela. Hi. How’s it going. This is the hardest letter I’ve ever had to write. (to Chandler) What the hell’s a matter with you? How do you think Joey’s going to react when he finds out that you blew off his sister with a letter?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, that’s the part where you tell him that I moved to France. When actually I’ll be in Cuba.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, look, look, you’ve got to do this yourself, okay in person. At least you know her name. You just go to the house and you ask for Mary-Angela, okay, when which ever one she is comes to the door, you take her for a walk, you let her down easy.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What if Mary-Angela comes to the door and I ask for Mary-Angela?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Where in Cuba?

content.description: Joey’s sister’s house, Chandler hits himself on the head three times and knocks on the door three times. Joey answers it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey, what-wh-wh-wha-wh-wha-wh-wha-wh-wha-what are you doing here?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Waiting for my Grandma to finish my laundry. What about you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m here to see Mary-Angela.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You are so the man! (motions him to come in, and he does) Now look, listen, listen, you got to be cool, ‘cause my Grandma doesn’t know about you two yet, and you do not want to tick her off. She was like the sixth person to spit on Mussolini’s hanging body. Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Where’s Mary-Angela?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: She’s right in there. (motions to the living room)
(Chandler walks into the living room, and sees all of Joey’s sisters, all wearing red.)

content.speaker: Joey’s Sisters
content.text: Hey, Chandler!

content.description: Central Perk, Monica, Ross, and Rachel are there.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I can’t believe Mark didn’t call. It’s Sunday night, and he didn’t call.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Bummer.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, right. Look at you, you’re practically giddy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, I’m genuinely sorry the Mark thing didn’t work out. Look, Rach, I want only good things for you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait a minute, why don’t you just call Mark. (they both look up in shock) I mean, who says you have to sit here and wait for him, you’ve got to make stuff happen.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: But, you, you don’t want to seem too pushy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Honey, it’s not pushy, he gave her his home number.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What, he gave you his home number? As in like, to, to his home?
content.parenthetical: to Rachel, as she gets his number

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, and you don’t mind if I call, because you only want good things for me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s right good things, that-that is what I said. (glances at Monica)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hello, Mark? Hi, it’s Rachel Green. (listens) Oh no, don’t you apologize. (listens) Yeah, I’ll hold. (to Monica and Ross) He left my number at work, but he was helping his niece with her report on the pioneers.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That is so made up!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, oh my God, tomorrow! That, no, it’s perfect. Oh God, thank you soo much. Great! Bye! (hangs up phone) I got the interview!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yay!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: There you go.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: He even offered to meet me for lunch tomorrow to prep me for it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, that is amazing!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah well, if I know Mark, and I think I do, I’d expect nothing less.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I got to figure out what I’m going to wear.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: High collar and baggy pants say I’m a pro.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah! Right! Okay, I’ll see you guys later. (starts to leave) Woo hoo!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You go get ‘em. (to Monica) What did I do to you? Did I hurt you in some way?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: ‘Why don’t you call him?!’ Well, thank you very much! Y’know now he is going to prep her, y’know prep her, as in what you do when you surgically remove the boyfriend!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you crazy?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Am I! Am I! Am I out of my mind! Am I losing my senses!! This dreamy guy is taking my girlfriend out for a meal.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?! Ross y’know this isn’t even about you! I mean this is about Rachel and something wonderful happening for her. I mean you know even if you’re right, what if he wants to sleep with her, does it mean he gets too?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I mean don’t you trust her?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, yeah!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Then get over yourself! Grow up!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You grow up.

content.description: Joey’s sister’s house, they’re finishing up dinner.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: This teramisu is, is excellent. Did you make it Mary-Angela?

content.speaker: Joey’s Grandmother
content.text: No! I did!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, it’s, it’s yummy. So Mary-Angela do you like it?

content.speaker: Joey’s Grandmother
content.text: Of course! It’s her favorite.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So um, Mary-Angela, what’s your second favorite?

content.speaker: Joey’s Grandmother
content.text: More of Grandma’s teramisu.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Would you just please…give me the receipt ‘cause this is great. It’s top notch.

content.speaker: Joey’s Grandmother
content.text: That dies with me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So will I.

content.speaker: Joey’s Sister
content.text: Excuse yourself, and go to the bathroom.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh no-no-no I was just squinting. That doesn’t mean anything.

content.speaker: Joey’s Sister
content.text: Just do it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Will you excuse me I have to um… (walks to the hall)
[cut to the hall, Joey’s sister runs up and grabs Chandler’s butt.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey’s Sister
content.text: Finally, I thought we’d never be alone. Can I just tell you something, I have not stopped thinking about you since the party. (kisses him)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, I may have jumped the gun here. (she tries to kiss him, but he ducks it and moves away) Um, I just got out of a relationship and I’m not really in a, in a commitment kind of place.

content.speaker: Joey’s Sister
content.text: So! Me neither! God, Mary-Angela was right you do have the softest lips.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ahhhh, you’re not Mary-Angela.

content.speaker: Joey’s Sister
content.text: No, I’m Mary-Theresa.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: This is so bad. If-if you’re not Mary-Angela, then-then who is?

content.speaker: Mary-Angela
content.text: I am!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, this is soo bad. (doesn’t see Mary-Angela)

content.speaker: Mary-Angela
content.text: Joey!!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No Joey! No Joey! Don’t Joey! Joey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What’s goin’ on?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re it! Now run and hide!

content.speaker: Mary-Theresa
content.text: It’s no big deal. Chandler was just kissin’ me because he thought I was Mary-Angela.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?! How could you do that, how could you think she was Mary-Angela?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I wasn’t sure which one Mary-Angela was. (all of Joey’s sisters gasp) Look, I’m sorry okay, I was really drunk, and you all look really similar.

content.speaker: Joey’s Sister
content.text: I say, punch him Joey.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yeah! Punch him!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know what, we should all calm down because your brother’s not going to punch me. (to Joey) Are ya?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, that is usually what I would do. But I just never thought you’d be on the receiving end of it. How could you do this?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey if you wanna punch me, go ahead, I deserve it. But I just want you to know that I would never soberly hurt you or your family, you’re my best friend. I would never do anything like this ever again.

content.speaker: Cookie
content.text: So what. I say, punch him.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yeah! Punch him! Punch him!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! No! No! No, I’m not going to punch Chandler.

content.speaker: Cookie
content.text: I’ll do it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No you won’t. Look he knows he did a terrible thing and I believe him, he’s sorry. But, (to Chandler) you’ve got one more apology to make, all right, you’ve got to apologize to Mary-Angela.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, absolutely!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’ve got it. (he starts to look at his sister’s, but he still doesn’t know which one is Mary-Angela.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Cookie, now you can punch him!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?! (Cookie punches him)

content.description: A lobby, Ross is waiting for Rachel, after her interview.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!
content.parenthetical: getting of the elevator and noticing Ross

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What are you doing here?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ah y’know, this building is on my paper route so I… (gives her a flower)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi. (kisses her)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How’d did it go?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh well, the woman I interviewed with was pretty tough, but y’know thank God Mark coached me, because once I started talking about the fall line, she got all happy and wouldn’t shut up.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m so proud of you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Me too!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Listen, I’m ah, I’m sorry I’ve been so crazy and jealous and, it’s just that I like you a lot, so…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: Rachel?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. (turns around) Hi Mark!

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: Hi. I just talked to Joanna, and she loves you. You got it, you got the job.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I did!

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God!! (she turns around and hugs Mark, not Ross)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Congradu!! (sees her hug Mark) -lations-lations.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, The entire gang is there.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So ah, Phoebe, how was your date?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh well y’know. (laughs)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, I do know.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ick, you were eavesdropping.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Eavesdropping. Pheebs, the ceiling tiles were falling down.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I’m sorry. But I really like this guy. And I think he really happens to like me.
(We hear the sound of a bed creaking through the ceiling, and him moaning.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Maybe he’s just jumping on a pogo-stick and really likes it?
(We hear a women start moaning.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Maybe the pogo-stick likes it too?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, that’s it! He cannot do this to Phoebe. (gets up) This guy is going to get the butt kicking of a lifetime! (stops and turns around and asks Rachel) But, is he a big guy?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ah, we’ll all go. (motions to Chandler) Come on. (the guys leave)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thanks you guys! Thank you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Don’t worry.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: God, I hope they kick his ass!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey, I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know if it’s any consolation, he really did sound like he was having more fun with you. (Rachel nods in agreement)
(We the guys knock on the door upstairs, and the guy answering it.)

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: May I help you?
(We hear the guys start to attack him, but the guy manages to calm them down and gets them to agree to what he did. Monica throws up her hands in disgust.)
